newsitem.title: UK: Pay your respects on Internet with virtual grave.
newsitem.headline: Pay your respects on Internet with virtual grave.

text.p: A British Methodist preacher is taking to the Internet to offer mourners a chance to pay electronic respects at virtual graves.
David Wilkinson is charging 150 pounds ($238) to set up an epitaph on the global computer network. It includes a 1,000-word obituary, photo and copy of the death certificate.

The preacher, who has received more than 100 inquiries from undertakers since advertising in the Funeral Services Journal, told the Guardian newspaper: "We are seeking to bring back the dignity to funerals.
"This way you get a record of someone's life. In 100 years' time, historians will welcome it."
